column19: The thriving 7yo CISCO DISCO has won here on three of his last four starts and can defy a 4lb penalty for last Tuesday's C&D victory.

column36: Two-time C&D winner who has been beaten just a neck here on his last two starts
column37: His last two wins came over C&D last May and he's been beaten just a neck over 1m here on his last two starts; runs off the same mark as last week (on soft; due a 2lb rise) and can be bang there once more.

column19: The thriving 7yo CISCO DISCO has won here on three of his last four starts and can defy a 4lb penalty for last Tuesday's C&D victory.
column20: 5/2 Cisco Disco, 3/1 Pol Roger, 9/2 Tee Aitch Aye, 11/2 Tafsir, 9/1 Sophiesticate, 10/1 Star Cast, 12/1 Idyllic, 20/1 Cascade Hall
column36: Short-headed over 1m4f at Hamilton last time and her surplus stamina may be no bad thing
column37: Course winner who was beaten by a short head at Hamilton (1m4f, soft) last time; she excels at Hamilton and has never won over a trip this short, but her surplus stamina may be no bad thing given the testing conditions.

column19: The thriving 7yo CISCO DISCO has won here on three of his last four starts and can defy a 4lb penalty for last Tuesday's C&D victory.
column20: 5/2 Cisco Disco, 3/1 Pol Roger, 9/2 Tee Aitch Aye, 11/2 Tafsir, 9/1 Sophiesticate, 10/1 Star Cast, 12/1 Idyllic, 20/1 Cascade Hall
column36: Three course wins from last four starts and may well take a 4lb penalty in his stride
column37: Made it three course wins from his last four starts when scoring over C&D (soft) nine days ago; came clear with an in-form runner-up last time and this rejuvenated 7yo may well take a 4lb penalty in his stride.

column19: The thriving 7yo CISCO DISCO has won here on three of his last four starts and can defy a 4lb penalty for last Tuesday's C&D victory.
column20: 5/2 Cisco Disco, 3/1 Pol Roger, 9/2 Tee Aitch Aye, 11/2 Tafsir, 9/1 Sophiesticate, 10/1 Star Cast, 12/1 Idyllic, 20/1 Cascade Hall
column36: Off the mark at Hamilton last month and that form has been firmly boosted by the runner-up
column37: Kept on for close fifth over C&D (good) in August then got off the mark at the ninth attempt at Hamilton (1m1f, soft) last month, when he was clear with one who has won his next two starts; respected up 4lb.

column19: The thriving 7yo CISCO DISCO has won here on three of his last four starts and can defy a 4lb penalty for last Tuesday's C&D victory.
column20: 5/2 Cisco Disco, 3/1 Pol Roger, 9/2 Tee Aitch Aye, 11/2 Tafsir, 9/1 Sophiesticate, 10/1 Star Cast, 12/1 Idyllic, 20/1 Cascade Hall
column36: Inconsistent and tailed off last time, but has won twice this year and is not written off
column37: Inconsistent filly who was tailed off at Newcastle (1m4f, AW) four weeks ago and is unproven on soft/heavy ground; however, she's won two of her seven starts this year (1m3f/1m4f, good to soft/good) and isn't written off.

column19: The thriving 7yo CISCO DISCO has won here on three of his last four starts and can defy a 4lb penalty for last Tuesday's C&D victory.
column20: 5/2 Cisco Disco, 3/1 Pol Roger, 9/2 Tee Aitch Aye, 11/2 Tafsir, 9/1 Sophiesticate, 10/1 Star Cast, 12/1 Idyllic, 20/1 Cascade Hall
column36: 0-6 but testing ground and the drop back down in trip could both be positives
column37: 3yo who is 0-6 and yet to seriously threaten, but Newcastle (1m4f, AW) on Saturday was a step back in the right direction and the drop back in trip could be a firm plus; best 2yo run came on soft ground; not a forlorn hope.

column19: The thriving 7yo CISCO DISCO has won here on three of his last four starts and can defy a 4lb penalty for last Tuesday's C&D victory.
column20: 5/2 Cisco Disco, 3/1 Pol Roger, 9/2 Tee Aitch Aye, 11/2 Tafsir, 9/1 Sophiesticate, 10/1 Star Cast, 12/1 Idyllic, 20/1 Cascade Hall
column36: Third over C&D nine days ago but was no match for Cisco Disco and needs something extra
column37: C&D winner who was on the scoresheet at Musselburgh (1m4f, good) in August; ran okay when third over C&D (soft) nine days ago but was no match for the first two (including Cisco Disco); needs something extra.

column19: The thriving 7yo CISCO DISCO has won here on three of his last four starts and can defy a 4lb penalty for last Tuesday's C&D victory.
column20: 5/2 Cisco Disco, 3/1 Pol Roger, 9/2 Tee Aitch Aye, 11/2 Tafsir, 9/1 Sophiesticate, 10/1 Star Cast, 12/1 Idyllic, 20/1 Cascade Hall
column36: Some good runs this season, including here, but tailed off on last two starts and now 0-17
column37: He's run some good races this season, including here, but tailed off on last two starts and now 0-17; others make greater appeal.

column4: Altos Tequila Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
column19: Having fared best of the newcomers when third on his debut here three weeks ago, NORTHERN BRAVE is preferred ahead of Wave Power.

column32: Middleham Park Racing Xxiii & M Hulin
column36: Half-brother to useful soft-ground winner but needs to improve a bundle for his C&D debut
column37: Half-brother to very useful 7f soft-ground winner Bill Silvers; he may have needed his debut outing over C&D (good to soft) three weeks ago but was well beaten at 9-1, finishing about 9l behind Northern Brave.

column4: Altos Tequila Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
column19: Having fared best of the newcomers when third on his debut here three weeks ago, NORTHERN BRAVE is preferred ahead of Wave Power.
column20: 4/9 Northern Brave, 7/2 Wave Power, 6/1 Gaelic Approach, 20/1 Naughty Boy
column36: Dam was a useful heavy-ground 6f 2yo winner but he was beaten a long way on debut
column37: His dam was a useful heavy-ground 6f 2yo winner but he was beaten a long way at 22-1 on last month's debut at Hamilton (6f, soft) and this Harry Angel gelding needs to leave that performance miles behind.

column4: Altos Tequila Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
column19: Having fared best of the newcomers when third on his debut here three weeks ago, NORTHERN BRAVE is preferred ahead of Wave Power.

column36: Promising third on debut over C&D three weeks ago and holds leading claims this afternoon
column37: Weak in the betting but showed promise when third on debut over C&D three weeks ago (good to soft), faring best of the newcomers; open to improvement and holds leading claims this afternoon.

column4: Altos Tequila Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
column19: Having fared best of the newcomers when third on his debut here three weeks ago, NORTHERN BRAVE is preferred ahead of Wave Power.
column20: 4/9 Northern Brave, 7/2 Wave Power, 6/1 Gaelic Approach, 20/1 Naughty Boy
column36: Fourth on soft ground at Hamilton on his second start and he's respected
column37: Displayed considerable improvement on his second start when keeping on for fourth at Hamilton (1m, soft; 150-1); he should be right at home in the testing conditions and he's respected.

column19: The filly GREEN VALENTINE looked a good prospect for this sort of trip when staying on well to win over 6f on soft ground at Hamilton.
column20: 6/4 Ahamoment, 7/2 Jkr Cobbler, 9/2 Edgewater Drive,  Green Valentine, 11/1 Military Leader, 20/1 Beauty Blossom,  Oh So Cool
column36: Four-time C&D winner, the latest last Tuesday; major player under a 5lb penalty
column37: Three C&D wins in 2023 and he added another last Tuesday (soft); major player under 5lb penalty if backing up that performance.

column19: The filly GREEN VALENTINE looked a good prospect for this sort of trip when staying on well to win over 6f on soft ground at Hamilton.

column32: D P Van Der Hoeven & D G Pryde
column36: 2-time C&D winner who won in fine style at Musselburgh last week; penalty may not stop him
column37: Having been running well he returned to winning ways at Musselburgh (7f, soft) last week; he enjoyed the run of the race in a prominent pitch but had plenty in hand and a 5lb penalty may not stop this two-time C&D winner.

column19: The filly GREEN VALENTINE looked a good prospect for this sort of trip when staying on well to win over 6f on soft ground at Hamilton.
column20: 6/4 Ahamoment, 7/2 Jkr Cobbler, 9/2 Edgewater Drive,  Green Valentine, 11/1 Military Leader, 20/1 Beauty Blossom,  Oh So Cool
column36: Recent win was over 5f but he's also won over a stiff 6f; in the mix if seeing it out
column37: Having had a wind op he returned to form to get up late at Catterick (5f, soft) last Wednesday; this lightly raced 4yo is unproven at 7f but he won twice over Carlisle's stiff 6f last year (including on soft going) and this trip may be within range; in the mix under penalty if seeing it out.

column19: The filly GREEN VALENTINE looked a good prospect for this sort of trip when staying on well to win over 6f on soft ground at Hamilton.
column20: 6/4 Ahamoment, 7/2 Jkr Cobbler, 9/2 Edgewater Drive,  Green Valentine, 11/1 Military Leader, 20/1 Beauty Blossom,  Oh So Cool
column36: Has shown ability but she was soundly beaten at 18-1 on recent handicap debut (7f, AW)
column37: Made debut in July and showed ability in novice contests on turf in August, but she was soundly beaten at 18-1 on her handicap debut at Newcastle (7f, AW) a fortnight ago; unraced on slow ground.

column19: The filly GREEN VALENTINE looked a good prospect for this sort of trip when staying on well to win over 6f on soft ground at Hamilton.
column20: 6/4 Ahamoment, 7/2 Jkr Cobbler, 9/2 Edgewater Drive,  Green Valentine, 11/1 Military Leader, 20/1 Beauty Blossom,  Oh So Cool
column36: Faded into fifth on handicap debut (1m, AW) and he's interesting now back down in trip
column37: Ex-Godolphin 4yo; encouraging fifth of 13 in first-time blinkers (retained) on last month's handicap debut at Newcastle (1m, AW), where he was in second passing the furlong pole; interesting now back down in trip.

column19: The filly GREEN VALENTINE looked a good prospect for this sort of trip when staying on well to win over 6f on soft ground at Hamilton.
column20: 6/4 Ahamoment, 7/2 Jkr Cobbler, 9/2 Edgewater Drive,  Green Valentine, 11/1 Military Leader, 20/1 Beauty Blossom,  Oh So Cool
column36: Hasn't shown enough in his first two handicaps to suggest he's the one to be on today
column37: Lightly raced 3yo who has potential in his pedigree but he hasn't shown enough in his first two handicaps to suggest he's the one to be on today.

column19: The filly GREEN VALENTINE looked a good prospect for this sort of trip when staying on well to win over 6f on soft ground at Hamilton.
column20: 6/4 Ahamoment, 7/2 Jkr Cobbler, 9/2 Edgewater Drive,  Green Valentine, 11/1 Military Leader, 20/1 Beauty Blossom,  Oh So Cool
column36: Unraced at 7f but stayed on for 25-1 win over 6f on soft ground at Hamilton last month
column37: Had been struggling for this yard prior to 25-1 win at Hamilton (6f, soft) last month when back on turf; unraced over 7f and her profile suggests she's not guaranteed to produce another good run, but she stayed on strongly last time and could be firmly involved with a repeat of that form.

column37: Hasn't fulfilled the promise of his 2023 2yo campaign but he was a close third off this mark at Salisbury four weeks ago (6f, heavy) and will be bang there if repeating that form.

column32: John Sagar And Dunham Trading Ltd
column36: Up and down this season but went close in the Bronze Cup over C&D two starts ago
column37: 9yo who is not easy to win with and has been up and down this season, finishing soundly beaten at Haydock last time; however, prior to that he went close in the Bronze Cup over C&D (soft) and is capable of having a big say.

column19: Today's testing ground will be a big positive for STATION X (nap), who won nurseries on heavy and soft going last autumn.

column36: Second of 13 over C&D last Tuesday off a career-low mark; player if backing that up
column37: His form has gone the wrong way this year but, having dropped to a career-low mark, he was second of 13 over C&D (soft) last Tuesday; he's a player if backing up that performance with another good one.

column19: Today's testing ground will be a big positive for STATION X (nap), who won nurseries on heavy and soft going last autumn.

column36: Only 9th in the Bronze Cup but in good form previously and he's at home on testing ground
column37: 4l ninth of 25 in the Bronze Cup over C&D (soft) three weeks ago but runner-up twice in a row prior to that (including C&D) and he won the Silver Cup over C&D in 2023; effective on soft/heavy and he's one to consider.

column19: Today's testing ground will be a big positive for STATION X (nap), who won nurseries on heavy and soft going last autumn.

column36: Wins on heavy/soft last autumn and this 3yo could improve for his recent outing
column37: Won two in a row at the end of his 2yo campaign (6f, heavy/soft) and began this season with two good runs in defeat (6f, good to soft/good); shaped as though he may have needed the run at Ripon (6f, good) 12 days ago after a three-month break and he's very much of interest with conditions to suit.

column19: Today's testing ground will be a big positive for STATION X (nap), who won nurseries on heavy and soft going last autumn.

column36: Has perhaps gone off the boil but he shouldn't be discounted off a dangerous mark
column37: Course regular who has perhaps gone off the boil judged on his last two performances, but he's a two-time course winner (including on heavy ground) who shouldn't be discounted off a dangerous mark.

column19: Today's testing ground will be a big positive for STATION X (nap), who won nurseries on heavy and soft going last autumn.
column20: 9/2 Station X, 5/1 Mister Sketch,  Lord Bertie, 6/1 Woven,  Wobwobwob, 10/1 Kelpie Grey, 11/1 Art Design,  Cargin Bhui, 14/1 Hour By Hour,  Rock Melody, 20/1 Iris Dancer
column36: Down the field on both 3yo outings but maybe today's conditions will trigger a revival
column37: Runner-up in two 6f nurseries on heavy/soft ground last autumn; down the field on both outings this year and has something to prove, but those were on good going and maybe today's testing conditions will trigger a revival.

column19: Today's testing ground will be a big positive for STATION X (nap), who won nurseries on heavy and soft going last autumn.

column36: Two wins on heavy ground last autumn but unable to threaten on soft going last month
column37: Three 6f wins last autumn, two of them on heavy ground; lightly raced this year but unable to threaten on soft going on his two outings last month and he needs to raise his game.

column19: Today's testing ground will be a big positive for STATION X (nap), who won nurseries on heavy and soft going last autumn.

column36: Below last winning mark but made it 0-8 for the year when finishing last here last week
column37: Soft-ground winner who is below her last winning mark and ran some pretty good races in defeat last month; however, she made it 0-8 for the year when finishing last here (7f, soft) last week and has to bounce back.

column19: Today's testing ground will be a big positive for STATION X (nap), who won nurseries on heavy and soft going last autumn.

column36: Three wins at Hamilton this summer but has failed to shine on last four outings
column37: Three wins at Hamilton this summer, the latest off today's mark, and she's effective on soft ground; however, she's failed to shine on her last four outings and has to get back on track.

column19: Today's testing ground will be a big positive for STATION X (nap), who won nurseries on heavy and soft going last autumn.

column36: August form suggested his turn may be near but he then finished last at Pontefract
column37: Posted two good thirds in August (6f, good to firm/good), suggesting his turn may be near; however, he finished last at Pontefract (6f, good to soft) last time and remains winless since scoring in January 2024 on his second start; unraced on soft/heavy ground.

column37: Having tumbled down the weights she returned to form when third at Haydock (7f, good to soft) a fortnight ago; won on heavy ground last season and in the mix if her renaissance wasn't a one-off.

column36: Now 8lb lower than when second in June but unable to threaten subsequently
column37: Has won on soft ground and he's now 8lb lower than when runner-up at Leicester (7f, good to firm) in June; however, he's finished no better than seventh across his five outings since.

column36: Three wins over 7f on Southwell AW but he seems to be inferior on turf
column37: His 12 starts have yielded three wins, all over 7f on Southwell AW, the latest in February when 4lb higher; however, not in the same form since and he appears to be inferior on turf.

column37: Went close at Doncaster (7f, good) two starts ago and he ran okay on his only encounter with soft ground (unraced on heavy); not ruled out but he's been up and down this season and can have issues at the start.

column19: This could go to EY UP ITS JAZZ, who arrives in fine form and will relish the testing conditions. Dwindling Funds is the danger.
column20: 15/8 Dwindling Funds, 9/4 Ey Up Its Jazz, 6/1 Kindest Nation, 10/1 Inanna, 11/1 Rich Rhythm, 12/1 Liamarty Dreams,  Coconut Bay, 16/1 Federal Envoy
column36: Won two in a row in July but hasn't been at her very best on her last three outings
column37: Won two in a row in July, including her second C&D victory (good to soft), and she's also won on soft ground; however, she hasn't been at her very best on her last three outings and needs something extra today.

column36: Right at home on soft/heavy ground and arrives in fine form; leading claims
column37: Front-runner who won here (1m, good to soft) in July and at Thirsk (7f, soft) last month before good second at Hamilton (1m, soft) last Monday behind one who has followed up; he's right at home on soft/heavy ground and holds leading claims off the same mark as last week.

column19: This could go to EY UP ITS JAZZ, who arrives in fine form and will relish the testing conditions. Dwindling Funds is the danger.

column32: D P Van Der Hoeven & D G Pryde
column36: Prolific of late and escapes a penalty for last Tuesday's soft ground win here
column37: Five wins in the second half of this year, four of them here, including two over 7f/1m last month (good to soft/soft) last month; it was an apprentice handicap last Tuesday so he escapes a penalty; major player.

column19: This could go to EY UP ITS JAZZ, who arrives in fine form and will relish the testing conditions. Dwindling Funds is the danger.
column20: 15/8 Dwindling Funds, 9/4 Ey Up Its Jazz, 6/1 Kindest Nation, 10/1 Inanna, 11/1 Rich Rhythm, 12/1 Liamarty Dreams,  Coconut Bay, 16/1 Federal Envoy
column36: Four wins this year but the testing conditions are a concern this afternoon
column37: Four wins this year, including over C&D (good), and went close twice in a row in August; however, she was below par on soft ground at Catterick last Wednesday and conditions are again a concern this afternoon.

column37: Won easily at Carlisle (1m1f, good) in August and he followed up at Musselburgh (1m1f, good) four days later; he's just 2lb higher than last time and is very much a contender if resuming where he left off following a two-month break, although he's unraced on soft/heavy ground.

column37: Runner-up at Carlisle (1m1f, soft) in June and now 2lb lower; however, his subsequent form has been patchy and his long losing run continues.

column37: Augmented previous gains on synthetics with August's Pontefract win (6f, good to firm), gained despite not settling; previous vulnerability off high-60s official marks evident again twice since, however.

column19: Value for closer in a Class 4 here latest, C&D regular MOE'S LEGACY (nap) is taken to deny the down-in-trip Silver Wraith.

column36: C&D nursery scorer (heavy); largely drying forecast not ideal; back down 2lb, at least.
column37: Took a C&D nursery (heavy) this time last year and September's Windsor score reaffirmed her greater effectiveness on slow ground, so largely drying forecast not ideal; back down 2lb now unpenalised again, at least.

column19: Value for closer in a Class 4 here latest, C&D regular MOE'S LEGACY (nap) is taken to deny the down-in-trip Silver Wraith.

column36: Back to June's Goodwood winning mark (6f, good); had two of these behind last time.
column37: Back to the same career-low mark she cashed in on in first-time blinkers at Goodwood in June (6f, good), progress having stalled again since; holds Connie's Rose and Papabella on last month's Leicester clash, albeit she was fairly well held herself; place rather than win claims.

column19: Value for closer in a Class 4 here latest, C&D regular MOE'S LEGACY (nap) is taken to deny the down-in-trip Silver Wraith.

column36: Lingfield Polytrack winner last time (5f); now tries a C&D that her dam won twice over.
column37: Her last-time Lingfield 0-60 Polytrack win (5f) wasn't coming out of turn, given she'd hit the frame in 12 consecutive defeats previously; more needed off 5lb extra and sharply raised in grade again, but the step up to a C&D her dam won twice over piques the interest.

column19: Value for closer in a Class 4 here latest, C&D regular MOE'S LEGACY (nap) is taken to deny the down-in-trip Silver Wraith.

column37: Denied Connie's Rose close home off 2lb higher at Chepstow in June (6f, good to firm), but behind that rival the last twice (softer ground not to blame) and her season is starting to trail off; others persuade more.

column36: 2lb rise for latest snug Lingfield win not insurmountable; returning to 1m sure to suit
column37: The winner of two of her five handicap runs this year, latterly coming from off the pace to win snugly at Lingfield (7f) five weeks ago; that form has taken some knocks but she's only 2lb higher and the return to 1m is sure to suit; not fully exposed.

column19: Grey Phoenix has more to offer but SAHANA can defy a small rise for last month's Lingfield success.
column20: 4/1 Sahana, 9/2 Mamma Maria,  Grey Phoenix, 11/2 Naga, 8/1 Suzuka, 10/1 Fool Again, 14/1 Cuban Girl, 16/1 Liv My Life,  Bella Bisbee,  Waiting For Love, 20/1 Dark Lyric, 25/1 Castro Aurum
column36: On winning mark and although recent fortunes have been mixed, a revival isn't impossible
column37: Back to the mark off which she ran away from eight rivals at Southwell in January (7f); mixed record since but has a chance if she's on one of her good days.

column19: Grey Phoenix has more to offer but SAHANA can defy a small rise for last month's Lingfield success.
column20: 4/1 Sahana, 9/2 Mamma Maria,  Grey Phoenix, 11/2 Naga, 8/1 Suzuka, 10/1 Fool Again, 14/1 Cuban Girl, 16/1 Liv My Life,  Bella Bisbee,  Waiting For Love, 20/1 Dark Lyric, 25/1 Castro Aurum

column36: Struggled in two handicap runs this year; drops in class but with a point to prove
column37: Eight-race maiden who has made little impact in two handicap runs this year; down in class today but not a solid option.

column19: Grey Phoenix has more to offer but SAHANA can defy a small rise for last month's Lingfield success.
column20: 4/1 Sahana, 9/2 Mamma Maria,  Grey Phoenix, 11/2 Naga, 8/1 Suzuka, 10/1 Fool Again, 14/1 Cuban Girl, 16/1 Liv My Life,  Bella Bisbee,  Waiting For Love, 20/1 Dark Lyric, 25/1 Castro Aurum
column32: Only Fillies Racing Club, R Pocock, Hcs
column36: Well short of best on last two starts; hopes rest on the switch to AW reviving fortunes
column37: Good start to the season but her form has dipped markedly on her last two starts; hopes pinned on the switch to AW turning around her fortunes.

column19: Grey Phoenix has more to offer but SAHANA can defy a small rise for last month's Lingfield success.
column20: 4/1 Sahana, 9/2 Mamma Maria,  Grey Phoenix, 11/2 Naga, 8/1 Suzuka, 10/1 Fool Again, 14/1 Cuban Girl, 16/1 Liv My Life,  Bella Bisbee,  Waiting For Love, 20/1 Dark Lyric, 25/1 Castro Aurum
column36: Struggled since her good second at Doncaster in June; headgear experiment quickly aborted
column37: Now 5lb lower than when second at Doncaster in June (1m, good to firm) but that is a result of some poor runs since; cheekpiece experiment quickly aborted.

column19: Grey Phoenix has more to offer but SAHANA can defy a small rise for last month's Lingfield success.
column20: 4/1 Sahana, 9/2 Mamma Maria,  Grey Phoenix, 11/2 Naga, 8/1 Suzuka, 10/1 Fool Again, 14/1 Cuban Girl, 16/1 Liv My Life,  Bella Bisbee,  Waiting For Love, 20/1 Dark Lyric, 25/1 Castro Aurum
column36: 3 solid efforts since returning to action; needs more progress to win but that's possible
column37: Returned from a 282-day absence to win at Ffos Las (1m, good) in August and she was first past the post at Salisbury 16 days later, only to be demoted to second; didn't run badly dropped to 7f at Thirsk last month but more will be needed if she is to take this.

column19: Grey Phoenix has more to offer but SAHANA can defy a small rise for last month's Lingfield success.
column20: 4/1 Sahana, 9/2 Mamma Maria,  Grey Phoenix, 11/2 Naga, 8/1 Suzuka, 10/1 Fool Again, 14/1 Cuban Girl, 16/1 Liv My Life,  Bella Bisbee,  Waiting For Love, 20/1 Dark Lyric, 25/1 Castro Aurum
column36: Struggled in handicaps since returning to action in June; too much to prove for now
column37: Promise as a 3yo, including a comfortable win in a Wolverhampton novice last December (8.6f); struggled since returning to action in June though and risky, for all she is dropping down the weights.

column19: Grey Phoenix has more to offer but SAHANA can defy a small rise for last month's Lingfield success.
column20: 4/1 Sahana, 9/2 Mamma Maria,  Grey Phoenix, 11/2 Naga, 8/1 Suzuka, 10/1 Fool Again, 14/1 Cuban Girl, 16/1 Liv My Life,  Bella Bisbee,  Waiting For Love, 20/1 Dark Lyric, 25/1 Castro Aurum
column36: Dropped away on August's stable debut but she had been progressive beforehand
column37: Progressive for Andrew Balding this summer, getting off the mark in a 1m handicap at Brighton in June; dropped away on stable debut at Sandown six weeks ago (1m, soft) and she will need to leave that effort well behind.

column19: Grey Phoenix has more to offer but SAHANA can defy a small rise for last month's Lingfield success.
column20: 4/1 Sahana, 9/2 Mamma Maria,  Grey Phoenix, 11/2 Naga, 8/1 Suzuka, 10/1 Fool Again, 14/1 Cuban Girl, 16/1 Liv My Life,  Bella Bisbee,  Waiting For Love, 20/1 Dark Lyric, 25/1 Castro Aurum
column36: Solid start to handicap career when fourth at Kempton (1m) three weeks ago; unexposed
column37: Fourth past the post in each of her five starts, running her best race so far when beaten 2l on last month's handicap debut at Kempton (1m); wasn't well positioned on that occasion and she remains capable of better.

column19: Grey Phoenix has more to offer but SAHANA can defy a small rise for last month's Lingfield success.
column20: 4/1 Sahana, 9/2 Mamma Maria,  Grey Phoenix, 11/2 Naga, 8/1 Suzuka, 10/1 Fool Again, 14/1 Cuban Girl, 16/1 Liv My Life,  Bella Bisbee,  Waiting For Love, 20/1 Dark Lyric, 25/1 Castro Aurum
column36: Not built on debut promise yet but there is still time and the return to AW should suit
column37: Promise amidst inexperience on her debut (7f, Tapeta) but yet to build on it in three runs since; raced too freely on soft ground on her handicap debut three weeks ago and that probably not the run to judge her on; unexposed.

column19: Grey Phoenix has more to offer but SAHANA can defy a small rise for last month's Lingfield success.
column20: 4/1 Sahana, 9/2 Mamma Maria,  Grey Phoenix, 11/2 Naga, 8/1 Suzuka, 10/1 Fool Again, 14/1 Cuban Girl, 16/1 Liv My Life,  Bella Bisbee,  Waiting For Love, 20/1 Dark Lyric, 25/1 Castro Aurum
column36: Free-going filly who comes here having been placed in her last three starts; e-w shout
column37: Free-going filly who comes here having been placed in her last three runs, including C&D; should run her race but perhaps vulnerable for win purposes once more.

column19: It might be worth chancing CINDERELLA MAN, who has raced too freely over 1m2f on recent outings and may benefit from the drop in trip.
column20: 13/8 Almizan, 7/2 Taskheer, 9/2 Cinderella Man, 7/1 Arthur Rose, 12/1 Night Arc,  Willow's Kiss, 14/1 Darlo Lady, 33/1 Tilsworth Max
column36: Didn't run badly last week but this regressive maiden is now 0-16 on AW
column37: Didn't run badly when fifth of ten at Kempton (1m) last week, his second start after a break, but this regressive 6yo is now 0-16 on AW.

column19: It might be worth chancing CINDERELLA MAN, who has raced too freely over 1m2f on recent outings and may benefit from the drop in trip.
column20: 13/8 Almizan, 7/2 Taskheer, 9/2 Cinderella Man, 7/1 Arthur Rose, 12/1 Night Arc,  Willow's Kiss, 14/1 Darlo Lady, 33/1 Tilsworth Max
column36: 0-6; seemed to have too much use made of him over 1m2f last time; interesting over 1m here
column37: Six-race maiden with a tendency to race too freely; seemed to have too much use made of him when tried in a visor (now removed) over 1m2f at Lingfield last month but he ran well for a long way and this drop in trip could be a good move.

column19: It might be worth chancing CINDERELLA MAN, who has raced too freely over 1m2f on recent outings and may benefit from the drop in trip.
column20: 13/8 Almizan, 7/2 Taskheer, 9/2 Cinderella Man, 7/1 Arthur Rose, 12/1 Night Arc,  Willow's Kiss, 14/1 Darlo Lady, 33/1 Tilsworth Max
column36: Opened account with clearcut 7f win here last month, her tenth run; 1m also suits
column37: Bounced back to form to open account with clearcut 7f win here last month, her tenth start; it's hard to predict whether she'll build on that success but a 4lb rise does not seem excessive and she should be okay back at 1m.

column19: It might be worth chancing CINDERELLA MAN, who has raced too freely over 1m2f on recent outings and may benefit from the drop in trip.
column20: 13/8 Almizan, 7/2 Taskheer, 9/2 Cinderella Man, 7/1 Arthur Rose, 12/1 Night Arc,  Willow's Kiss, 14/1 Darlo Lady, 33/1 Tilsworth Max
column36: Didn't really fire over 7f last time but placed over 1m two starts ago; one to consider
column37: Back to form to land a gamble in 1m Lingfield classified in February and was placed in a handicap over that C&D in August; didn't really fire over 7f there last time but still considered in this modest race.

column19: It might be worth chancing CINDERELLA MAN, who has raced too freely over 1m2f on recent outings and may benefit from the drop in trip.
column20: 13/8 Almizan, 7/2 Taskheer, 9/2 Cinderella Man, 7/1 Arthur Rose, 12/1 Night Arc,  Willow's Kiss, 14/1 Darlo Lady, 33/1 Tilsworth Max
column36: 0-14 in Ireland but makes stable debut from workable mark; market may guide
column37: 0-14 when based in Ireland, signing off with down-the-field run on soft ground last month; makes stable debut from a good mark, though, and worth keeping an eye on in the betting; headgear (worn last six starts) discarded.

column19: It might be worth chancing CINDERELLA MAN, who has raced too freely over 1m2f on recent outings and may benefit from the drop in trip.
column20: 13/8 Almizan, 7/2 Taskheer, 9/2 Cinderella Man, 7/1 Arthur Rose, 12/1 Night Arc,  Willow's Kiss, 14/1 Darlo Lady, 33/1 Tilsworth Max
column36: Nine-race maiden who needs wind op and tongue-tie to make a big difference today
column37: Showed some promise in early part of this year but was last of 12 in Yarmouth classified (1m, good to firm) in August and has now been unplaced all nine starts; needs combination of wind surgery and first-time tongue-tie to make a big difference.

column19: It might be worth chancing CINDERELLA MAN, who has raced too freely over 1m2f on recent outings and may benefit from the drop in trip.

column36: Nine-race maiden; struggled on turf last time and makes only limited appeal
column37: Nine-race maiden; ran reasonably well when fifth of nine in Yarmouth handicap (1m, good to soft) in July but was always struggling after slow start there last time and makes only limited appeal.

column36: 19-race maiden who is usually unable to get seriously competitive
column37: 19-race maiden who is usually unable to get seriously competitive; moves back up from 7f today.

column36: Drops back in grade and stays this trip but not the percentage call on this rare AW outing
column37: Last won two years ago but was a close fourth at Hamilton (good to soft) on his penultimate start; couldn't match that on soft ground at Ayr (also 1m5f) three weeks ago; drops back in grade and stays this trip but still not the percentage call on this rare AW outing.

column19: Unexposed EDWARDTHENINTH attracted support when a good second over C&D on his first go for Ruth Jefferson and gets the nod.
column20: 11/4 Both Of Us, 100/30 Stand Strong,  Edwardtheninth, 7/1 Quercus Robur, 8/1 Reel Her In, 12/1 Billy No Mates,  Team Endeavour, 16/1 Gastronomy, 40/1 Himself
column36: Losing run is mounting up and not easy to recommend after heavy C&D defeat one month ago
column37: Won twice last year, including over 12.5f here, but his losing run is beginning to mount up; now 6lb below his last winning mark but not easy to recommend after a heavy defeat over C&D one month ago.

column19: Unexposed EDWARDTHENINTH attracted support when a good second over C&D on his first go for Ruth Jefferson and gets the nod.
column20: 11/4 Both Of Us, 100/30 Stand Strong,  Edwardtheninth, 7/1 Quercus Robur, 8/1 Reel Her In, 12/1 Billy No Mates,  Team Endeavour, 16/1 Gastronomy, 40/1 Himself
column36: Won (2m1f, good to soft) in May; 2lb nudge is fair but big hurdles defeat when last seen
column37: Three-time Flat winner since joining Ben Haslam last summer, most recently at Carlisle (2m1f, good to soft) in May; 2lb nudge for that looks fair but suffered a heavy defeat over hurdles when last seen in June; market support would boost her claims.

column19: Unexposed EDWARDTHENINTH attracted support when a good second over C&D on his first go for Ruth Jefferson and gets the nod.

column32: A Whillans, W Orr, C Spark, J Wright
column36: Solid over C&D of late, won in August then second latest; same mark; leading contender
column37: Solid over C&D of late, running out a convincing winner to make his breakthrough at the start of August before a narrow second a fortnight ago; same mark here and he's a leading contender.

column19: Unexposed EDWARDTHENINTH attracted support when a good second over C&D on his first go for Ruth Jefferson and gets the nod.
column20: 11/4 Both Of Us, 100/30 Stand Strong,  Edwardtheninth, 7/1 Quercus Robur, 8/1 Reel Her In, 12/1 Billy No Mates,  Team Endeavour, 16/1 Gastronomy, 40/1 Himself
column36: Won 3rd C&D race one month ago; flopped latest but that was messy; could well bounce back
column37: Course regular who landed a fourth win here (his third over this trip) when 28-1 and beating Edwardtheninth one month ago; flopped under a 5lb penalty the following week (Team Endeavour second) but that tactical race may be best ignored; could well bounce back.

column19: Unexposed EDWARDTHENINTH attracted support when a good second over C&D on his first go for Ruth Jefferson and gets the nod.
column20: 11/4 Both Of Us, 100/30 Stand Strong,  Edwardtheninth, 7/1 Quercus Robur, 8/1 Reel Her In, 12/1 Billy No Mates,  Team Endeavour, 16/1 Gastronomy, 40/1 Himself
column36: Gelded, up in trip and yard debut when 2nd over C&D last month; unexposed; plenty to like
column37: No impression in two handicaps (1m4f/1m2f) for Marcus Tregoning about a year ago; gelding operation, switch to this yard and step up in trip saw him in better light when a closing second of 12 behind Quercus Robur over C&D last month; unexposed and the front pair pulled well clear that day; plenty to like.

column19: Unexposed EDWARDTHENINTH attracted support when a good second over C&D on his first go for Ruth Jefferson and gets the nod.
column20: 11/4 Both Of Us, 100/30 Stand Strong,  Edwardtheninth, 7/1 Quercus Robur, 8/1 Reel Her In, 12/1 Billy No Mates,  Team Endeavour, 16/1 Gastronomy, 40/1 Himself
column36: Improved over 1m4f last month, with form figures of 1122; up in trip again; big player
column37: Progressive 3yo who improved in four starts over 1m4f last month, winning at Brighton (soft) and Southwell (by 6l) before finishing second here 11 days ago and again at Hamilton (soft) 24 hours later; well worth a go at this trip and he's not one to oppose lightly.

column19: Unexposed EDWARDTHENINTH attracted support when a good second over C&D on his first go for Ruth Jefferson and gets the nod.
column20: 11/4 Both Of Us, 100/30 Stand Strong,  Edwardtheninth, 7/1 Quercus Robur, 8/1 Reel Her In, 12/1 Billy No Mates,  Team Endeavour, 16/1 Gastronomy, 40/1 Himself
column36: 2nd of five (28-1) over C&D three weeks ago but that was a messy event; bit more needed
column37: 1-24, the win coming by a nose at Wetherby (2m, good to firm) over two years ago; 28-1 when second of five over C&D (Quercus Robur last) three weeks ago but that was a messy event and he'll need a bit more today.

column19: Unexposed EDWARDTHENINTH attracted support when a good second over C&D on his first go for Ruth Jefferson and gets the nod.

column36: 17-race maiden; heavy defeats on last two starts; switch back to AW isn't enough to tempt
column37: 17-race maiden who suffered heavy defeats on his last two starts, including when cheekpieces were given a whirl last time (now removed); switch back to AW isn't enough to tempt.

column37: 0-7 but ran to a solid level when third in three good-ground handicaps (11.5f-14.5f) in the spring; just held in Kempton maiden (1m3f, Polytrack) on her comeback last Wednesday; player.

column36: Stays 1m4f and has won on Tapeta including off this mark in June (8.5f); case to be made
column37: 0-10 here but scored at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) in February; campaigned over shorter since March and won again at that venue (8.5f) in June; case to be made now he's back on that winning mark.

column19: The vote goes to SPEECHMAN in the hope his recent revival over C&D was not a flash in the pan.

column36: Romped off with 1m6f handicap (soft) last week; 3lb well in; drop in trip on AW a query
column37: Stays well and he made the breakthrough over 2m at Redcar (good to soft) in July; three lesser efforts followed but he was back on that mark when romping off with a Musselburgh handicap (1m6f, soft) last Wednesday; 3lb well in under the penalty but he's 0-3 here and the drop back in trip does raise a slight query.

column36: Heavy good-ground defeat for 3rd time this year latest; cheekpieces off for his AW debut
column37: Ten-race maiden; two respectable efforts on soft at about 1m across August and September but he was beaten a long way a fortnight ago and that was the third time this season he's suffered a heavy defeat on good ground; cheekpieces removed for this AW debut.

column36: Showed more (much reduced mark) when beaten 1l (C&D) latest; can build on that
column37: Useful as recently as June 2024 when trained in France; rating plummeted after some grim results since but showed much more when beaten 1l for fourth over C&D (Fleur De Mer 3l behind) a fortnight ago; may finally have rediscovered his level.

column37: Two Tapeta wins in 2023 included one over 1m2f here; big run when second in a higher grade last month but didn't back that up when fifth of eight (also C&D; Speechman 3l ahead) a fortnight ago; chance on that earlier form.

column19: The vote goes to SPEECHMAN in the hope his recent revival over C&D was not a flash in the pan.

column36: Narrow win (1m4f) a fortnight ago; not matched over 1m2f (also good to soft) on Saturday
column37: 0-9 on AW; reportedly benefited from removal of blinkers with narrow win at Pontefract (1m4f; front pair clear) a fortnight ago but underwhelmed over 1m2f (also good to soft) at Redcar on Saturday; step back up to this trip should help.

column37: A specialist around here with five of his 11 wins under rules coming at the track (three of them chasing); beat Lady Rose Hackett by 0.75l over C&D on penultimate start; 3lb worse off with that rival now and was tailed off at Ballinrobe last time; always gives his best around here but others preferred.

column19: LADY ROSE HACKETT wasn't beaten far over C&D by Itsalonglongroad on chasing debut and with normal improvement she should go close
column20: 5/2 Lady Rose Hackett, 3/1 May Call You Back, 9/2 Sayitfirst, 7/1 Be Fierce, 8/1 Itsalonglongroad, 10/1 Takarengo, 15/1 Lake Chad,  Polly Poppins, 50/1 Added Bonus
column27: Jas Linnane, J Moore & B Gardiner
column36: Best of recent Flat efforts came here; not ruled out if improving poor jumping
column37: Three-time winner on the Flat and has one win over hurdles but 0-8 in the chasing department; has been running on the Flat recently and best of those efforts came here when a 1l second (2m, good to yielding); has not exhibited fluent jumping in this sphere but if getting that together he is not ruled out.

column19: LADY ROSE HACKETT wasn't beaten far over C&D by Itsalonglongroad on chasing debut and with normal improvement she should go close
column20: 5/2 Lady Rose Hackett, 3/1 May Call You Back, 9/2 Sayitfirst, 7/1 Be Fierce, 8/1 Itsalonglongroad, 10/1 Takarengo, 15/1 Lake Chad,  Polly Poppins, 50/1 Added Bonus
column36: Two-time chase winner went close over hurdles here last time; in the mix
column37: Comfortable handicap hurdle winner here in May (2m, good to yielding) and followed up with second chasing success at Tipperary off 88 (2m, yielding); underwhelming fourth at Wexford when sent off a shade of odds-on at Wexford on penultimate but went close here back over hurdles last time when beaten 0.5l off 98 (2m, good); in the mix.

column19: LADY ROSE HACKETT wasn't beaten far over C&D by Itsalonglongroad on chasing debut and with normal improvement she should go close
column20: 5/2 Lady Rose Hackett, 3/1 May Call You Back, 9/2 Sayitfirst, 7/1 Be Fierce, 8/1 Itsalonglongroad, 10/1 Takarengo, 15/1 Lake Chad,  Polly Poppins, 50/1 Added Bonus
column27: W D And Mrs A C Hockenhull
column36: 0-6 over hurdles but went close to immediate chasing win when a close second over C&D
column37: No wins in six hurdle runs but went close to making an immediate start over fences when beaten under a length by Itsalonglongroad over C&D last time (good); won sole point-to-point on soft/heavy so ground should be fine; good chance.

column19: LADY ROSE HACKETT wasn't beaten far over C&D by Itsalonglongroad on chasing debut and with normal improvement she should go close
column20: 5/2 Lady Rose Hackett, 3/1 May Call You Back, 9/2 Sayitfirst, 7/1 Be Fierce, 8/1 Itsalonglongroad, 10/1 Takarengo, 15/1 Lake Chad,  Polly Poppins, 50/1 Added Bonus
column32: Profit In Your Pocket Racing Club
column36: Got first chasing win last time; 3lb higher now but good chance if in same form
column37: Two-time winner over hurdles bagged her first chase win at the fourth attempt at Sligo last time from 5lb out of handicap (2m1f, good to yielding); up 3lb now but good chance if in the same form as her win.

column19: LADY ROSE HACKETT wasn't beaten far over C&D by Itsalonglongroad on chasing debut and with normal improvement she should go close
column20: 5/2 Lady Rose Hackett, 3/1 May Call You Back, 9/2 Sayitfirst, 7/1 Be Fierce, 8/1 Itsalonglongroad, 10/1 Takarengo, 15/1 Lake Chad,  Polly Poppins, 50/1 Added Bonus
column36: Best of 11 hurdle runs have come here, beaten a head here in Aug'; lesser runs last twice
column37: Best of her 11 hurdle runs have come here, beaten just a head in August (2m, good); lesser run at Listowel following that and tailed off at Clonmel last time when upped in trip; sometimes reluctant to line up but this track is a big positive for her chase debut.

column19: LADY ROSE HACKETT wasn't beaten far over C&D by Itsalonglongroad on chasing debut and with normal improvement she should go close
column20: 5/2 Lady Rose Hackett, 3/1 May Call You Back, 9/2 Sayitfirst, 7/1 Be Fierce, 8/1 Itsalonglongroad, 10/1 Takarengo, 15/1 Lake Chad,  Polly Poppins, 50/1 Added Bonus
column36: Two-time chase winner hasn't shown anything in runs this year; 11lb wrong
column37: Two-time winner over fences with last win coming in February last year (2m, soft to heavy); hasn't shown anything this year; 11lb wrong.

column19: The Gavin Cromwell-trained JUKE BOX ROCK strung together three good hurdle runs recently and looks like one of the main players here
column20: 5/2 Juke Box Rock, 9/2 Figurehead, 6/1 North Moon, 7/1 Mullanour, 8/1 Kells Priory,  Sharetheknowledge, 12/1 Menas Miracle, 15/1 Prized Jet, 16/1 Mount Shenshan, 20/1 Wakey Wakey Man
column36: 0-39 under rules but ran well on Flat and over fences recently; may find a few too good
column37: 0-39 under rules; finished 16l behind on debut over fences here (2m6f, good to yielding) but better effort in a staying Flat handicap at Navan (1m6f, yielding) and when second back over fences at Downpatrick last time (2m2f, yielding); can go well but may find one or two too good again.

column19: The Gavin Cromwell-trained JUKE BOX ROCK strung together three good hurdle runs recently and looks like one of the main players here
column20: 5/2 Juke Box Rock, 9/2 Figurehead, 6/1 North Moon, 7/1 Mullanour, 8/1 Kells Priory,  Sharetheknowledge, 12/1 Menas Miracle, 15/1 Prized Jet, 16/1 Mount Shenshan, 20/1 Wakey Wakey Man
column36: Shaped nicely in last three h'cap hurdle runs; chance on chasing debut
column37: Shaped nicely in last three handicap hurdle runs; bumped into a well handicapped rival at Navan last time when a 5.5l second (2m3f, yielding); good chance.

column19: The Gavin Cromwell-trained JUKE BOX ROCK strung together three good hurdle runs recently and looks like one of the main players here
column20: 5/2 Juke Box Rock, 9/2 Figurehead, 6/1 North Moon, 7/1 Mullanour, 8/1 Kells Priory,  Sharetheknowledge, 12/1 Menas Miracle, 15/1 Prized Jet, 16/1 Mount Shenshan, 20/1 Wakey Wakey Man
column36: Disappointing since his hurdle win last summer and has plenty to prove on chase debut
column37: Won over hurdles at Killarney (2m4f, good) last July but he's been disappointing since and was tailed off at Clonmel when last seen in June; has plenty to prove now switched to chasing and he needs a major revival; another change of headgear.

column19: The Gavin Cromwell-trained JUKE BOX ROCK strung together three good hurdle runs recently and looks like one of the main players here
column20: 5/2 Juke Box Rock, 9/2 Figurehead, 6/1 North Moon, 7/1 Mullanour, 8/1 Kells Priory,  Sharetheknowledge, 12/1 Menas Miracle, 15/1 Prized Jet, 16/1 Mount Shenshan, 20/1 Wakey Wakey Man
column36: Point winner has some good placed form in h'caps inc' here; fell here on chase debut
column37: Grabbed point-to-point win at the third attempt; made little impact in maiden starts but some placed form in handicaps, including here in April (2m5f, yielding); not completely out of it when falling at the third from home on chasing debut here in May (2m6f, good to yielding); pulled up over hurdles at Punchestown last time.

column19: The Gavin Cromwell-trained JUKE BOX ROCK strung together three good hurdle runs recently and looks like one of the main players here
column20: 5/2 Juke Box Rock, 9/2 Figurehead, 6/1 North Moon, 7/1 Mullanour, 8/1 Kells Priory,  Sharetheknowledge, 12/1 Menas Miracle, 15/1 Prized Jet, 16/1 Mount Shenshan, 20/1 Wakey Wakey Man
column27: S A R L European Bloodstock Management Ebm
column36: Tailed off in two of three maiden hurdle runs; little to recommend other than the yard
column37: Midfield finish on bumper debut at Wexford; tailed off in two of three maiden hurdle runs, okay effort at Downpatrick when a 6.25l fourth of six (2m6f, good), sandwiched between two poor runs; little to recommend him other than the yard he hails from.

column19: The Gavin Cromwell-trained JUKE BOX ROCK strung together three good hurdle runs recently and looks like one of the main players here
column20: 5/2 Juke Box Rock, 9/2 Figurehead, 6/1 North Moon, 7/1 Mullanour, 8/1 Kells Priory,  Sharetheknowledge, 12/1 Menas Miracle, 15/1 Prized Jet, 16/1 Mount Shenshan, 20/1 Wakey Wakey Man
column36: Some decent efforts over hurdles but lesser runs recently; not ruled out on chasing debut
column37: Pulled up on point debut before a decent 6l fourth at Bartlemy; a couple of decent runs over hurdles, particularly when beaten a head at Clonmel in May off 98 (2m3f, good); recent runs leave a bit to be desired, but not ruled out on chasing debut.

column19: The Gavin Cromwell-trained JUKE BOX ROCK strung together three good hurdle runs recently and looks like one of the main players here
column20: 5/2 Juke Box Rock, 9/2 Figurehead, 6/1 North Moon, 7/1 Mullanour, 8/1 Kells Priory,  Sharetheknowledge, 12/1 Menas Miracle, 15/1 Prized Jet, 16/1 Mount Shenshan, 20/1 Wakey Wakey Man
column36: Beaten over ten lengths in two points and well behind in 6 hurdle starts
column37: Beaten over 10l in two point-to-point starts and well behind in five maiden hurdles and on his handicap debut at Galway last time; fences need to transform him.

column19: The Gavin Cromwell-trained JUKE BOX ROCK strung together three good hurdle runs recently and looks like one of the main players here
column20: 5/2 Juke Box Rock, 9/2 Figurehead, 6/1 North Moon, 7/1 Mullanour, 8/1 Kells Priory,  Sharetheknowledge, 12/1 Menas Miracle, 15/1 Prized Jet, 16/1 Mount Shenshan, 20/1 Wakey Wakey Man
column36: Winner of only point but has struggled off revised hurdles mark following July win
column37: Winner of only point start and got off the mark over hurdles at Wexford in July (2m1f, good) following a good run here prior when a close second (2m5f, good to yielding); has struggled off revised mark over hurdles on last two runs and even that mark leaves her with something to find; could be an improver over fences though.

column19: The Gavin Cromwell-trained JUKE BOX ROCK strung together three good hurdle runs recently and looks like one of the main players here
column20: 5/2 Juke Box Rock, 9/2 Figurehead, 6/1 North Moon, 7/1 Mullanour, 8/1 Kells Priory,  Sharetheknowledge, 12/1 Menas Miracle, 15/1 Prized Jet, 16/1 Mount Shenshan, 20/1 Wakey Wakey Man
column36: 1-7 over hurdles but has failed to complete in 3 chase starts; others more likely
column37: 1-7 record over hurdles but has failed to complete last three chase starts (unseated twice before pulling up at Tipperary last time); point-to-point record is not particularly noteworthy either; soft ground is a positive, but others more likely.

column19: The Gavin Cromwell-trained JUKE BOX ROCK strung together three good hurdle runs recently and looks like one of the main players here
column20: 5/2 Juke Box Rock, 9/2 Figurehead, 6/1 North Moon, 7/1 Mullanour, 8/1 Kells Priory,  Sharetheknowledge, 12/1 Menas Miracle, 15/1 Prized Jet, 16/1 Mount Shenshan, 20/1 Wakey Wakey Man
column36: Runner-up in sole point and some okay runs in m'dens (inc here); needs more on chase debut
column37: Runner-up in sole point-to-point start and some okay runs in defeat in two of three maiden hurdle starts (including here when fourth of ten in August); needs to improve, but perhaps fences can eke out some more.

column4: Copper Coast (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
column20: 2/1 Wartime Leader,  Boo Radley, 5/1 Moon Mission,  Barra Rua, 16/1 Goodmancon,  Paymelater, 20/1 Le Roi Du Livet, 33/1 Beara Beauty
column36: 10l 3rd in this last year; hasn't matched that form this season
column37: 10l third in this race last year is the best of his seven runs so far; hasn't matched that form in four runs this year and needs first-time tongue-tie to spark a revival.

column4: Copper Coast (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
column20: 2/1 Wartime Leader,  Boo Radley, 5/1 Moon Mission,  Barra Rua, 16/1 Goodmancon,  Paymelater, 20/1 Le Roi Du Livet, 33/1 Beara Beauty
column36: Back to something like his best when a distant 4th in Bellewstown bumper; tough ask
column37: Back to his best when a distant fourth in a Bellewstown bumper in August; has to step up on what he's achieved in seven runs so far.

column4: Copper Coast (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
column20: 2/1 Wartime Leader,  Boo Radley, 5/1 Moon Mission,  Barra Rua, 16/1 Goodmancon,  Paymelater, 20/1 Le Roi Du Livet, 33/1 Beara Beauty
column36: 3rd in Galway bumper for Willie Mullins; lesser run at Kilbeggan; bought for 3,200g since
column37: Runner-up in a Naas bumper on debut in January 2024 before two starts for Willie Mullins; finished 5l third in a Galway Festival bumper this year but produced a lesser effort when fifth in a Kilbeggan bumper last month; bought for 3,200gns since and drops in trip for yard debut; a return to his better efforts would give him solid claims.

column4: Copper Coast (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
column20: 2/1 Wartime Leader,  Boo Radley, 5/1 Moon Mission,  Barra Rua, 16/1 Goodmancon,  Paymelater, 20/1 Le Roi Du Livet, 33/1 Beara Beauty
column32: Brian M Keenan & P W Mullins
column36: 13-8 for Roscommon bumper but tailed off; good chance he'll do better this time
column37: Sent off 13-8 for a Roscommon bumper in August but finished tailed off and was reportedly blowing hard post-race; good chance he'll do better this time for a yard with a remarkable strike-rate in bumpers.

column4: Copper Coast (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race

column27: S A S Elevage Du Livet
column36: Only beat one home when 11-1 for a seven-runner Kilbeggan bumper; off five months
column37: Only beat one home when 11-1 for a seven-runner Kilbeggan bumper; off five months and needs to leave that run behind.

column4: Copper Coast (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
column20: 2/1 Wartime Leader,  Boo Radley, 5/1 Moon Mission,  Barra Rua, 16/1 Goodmancon,  Paymelater, 20/1 Le Roi Du Livet, 33/1 Beara Beauty
column36: Distant 3rd in Ballinrobe bumper in May was promising but hasn't kicked on since
column37: Distant third in a Ballinrobe bumper in May was promising but hasn't really kicked on twice since; more required.

column4: Copper Coast (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
column20: 2/1 Wartime Leader,  Boo Radley, 5/1 Moon Mission,  Barra Rua, 16/1 Goodmancon,  Paymelater, 20/1 Le Roi Du Livet, 33/1 Beara Beauty
column36: 2nd from front in Limerick bumper on debut; hasn't progressed; form of latest 3rd boosted
column37: Went close from the front in a Limerick bumper in May; beaten favourite when an 8l fourth at Roscommon and may not have appreciated step up in trip when a distant third at Sligo since; runner-up has boosted that form and not ruled out.

column4: Copper Coast (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
column20: 2/1 Wartime Leader,  Boo Radley, 5/1 Moon Mission,  Barra Rua, 16/1 Goodmancon,  Paymelater, 20/1 Le Roi Du Livet, 33/1 Beara Beauty
column36: Saddex filly; yard 3-143 in Irish bumpers last five years; others preferred
column37: Saddex filly; dam unraced, out of French 1m1f winning half-sister to 1m2f Group 1 winner Ridasiyna and useful 2m hurdler Ranjaan; yard 3-143 in Irish bumpers last five years; others preferred.
